OnePlus 13 Amazon Exchange offer: How to buy the latest OnePlus mobile under ₹40,000 - HT Tech
summary:
OnePlus 13 Amazon Exchange offer: How to buy the latest OnePlus mobile under ₹40,000

Publication Date: 7 January 2023

Source: Hindustan Times

OnePlus 13, the latest flagship from OnePlus, is now available for open sale in India. Launched earlier this month, the phone is priced at ₹69,999. Here, let us tell you how you can get it for much less than that by combining two offers: an exchange offer and a bank discount.

Here's how you can grab the OnePlus 13 for under ₹40,000

Currently, the OnePlus 13 is selling at its full price of ₹69,999. However, if you have a compatible credit card, you can get an instant discount of ₹5,000. This brings the price down to ₹64,999.

To make the deal even better, exchange offers are available. For example, if you own a OnePlus 12, you can trade in your old phone for a good amount. Amazon is offering up to ₹28,500 for the exchange of a OnePlus 12 base model, provided the device is in optimal condition. After factoring in the exchange offer, the effective price drops to ₹36,499.

At this price, the OnePlus 13 becomes a value for money deal, especially since it features cutting-edge internals like the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset. There are additional offers as well, such as no-cost EMI plans for up to 12 months.

OnePlus 13: Should you buy?

For its price, the OnePlus 13 is one of the most powerful smartphones available. It comes in fun colours, including Midnight (with a vegan leather back), Arctic Dawn, and Black Eclipse. It offers up to 1TB of storage and 24GB RAM, perfect for power users. The device features a 6,000mAh battery for long-lasting performance, and Hasselblad-tuned cameras have significant improvements, along with a refined design.
newTitle: OnePlus 13 Amazon Exchange Offer: Buy the Latest Mobile Under ₹40,000

title: Tripura High Court Seeks Updated Statistics Of HIV/ AIDS Patients In State - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Tripura High Court Seeks Updated Statistics Of HIV/ AIDS Patients In State

Publication Date: Date not provided

Source: Live Law

The Tripura High Court has ordered the Tripura State AIDS Control Society to submit updated statistics regarding the incidence of HIV/AIDS patients, emphasizing the need to evaluate the effectiveness of ongoing measures against the rising trend of cases.

  • The court is addressing the issue through a suo moto PIL and has requested the National AIDS Control Organization (NACO) for establishment approvals of new treatment centers.
  • The court noted existing facilities, including 24 Stand Alone Integrated Counseling & Testing Centres and 133 more integrated ones for testing services.
  • Enhanced support for high-risk groups is highlighted through various initiatives, including 23 Opioid Substitution Therapy centres.
  • A progress report from the Tripura State AIDS Control Society is mandated by the court.
“Three numbers of PPP model ICTC Centres and one number of Mobile ICTC Van is functional in the State.”

The matter will be revisited in court on February 20.
newTitle: Tripura High Court Seeks Updated Statistics Of HIV/ AIDS Patients In State

title: Can astronauts have sex in space, how will a child born in space look like? - India.com
summary:
Can Astronauts Have Sex in Space and What Would a Child Born in Space Look Like?

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: India.com

Life Beyond Earth: Humans have long been fascinated by the possibility of life beyond Earth. As exploration progresses, questions surface about human reproduction in space. Can a human child be born in space?

Key Points:

  • Pregnancy can potentially occur in space, but poses significant risks due to the unique environment.
  • Zero gravity can lead to a loss of bone density, making childbirth dangerous.
  • Radiation in space can cause genetic abnormalities or health issues for the fetus.
  • A child born in space could exhibit abnormal growth patterns due to the absence of gravity.
  • Previous animal experiments in space provided some insights but do not guarantee similar success in humans.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“In zero gravity, astronauts lose bone density by up to 12 percent in just six months.”

Ultimately, while the exploration of human life in space remains an exciting frontier, significant challenges must be addressed before reproduction in space becomes feasible.
newTitle: Can Astronauts Have Sex in Space and What Would a Child Born in Space Look Like?

Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty tanks, rupee hits all-time low - Hindustan Times
summary:
Stock Market Crash: Sensex and Nifty Plummet as Rupee Hits Record Low

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The stock market faced a major setback on January 13, 2025, as the benchmark indices tumbled significantly. The BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty both reported steep declines, while the Indian rupee hit an all-time low against the US dollar.

  • The BSE Sensex fell by 677.22 points (0.88%) to 76,701.69.
  • The NSE Nifty decreased by 212.90 points (0.91%) to 23,218.60.
  • The rupee reached an all-time low of 86.3537 per dollar.
  • Major losers among Sensex stocks included Zomato (-2.86%), Mahindra & Mahindra (-2.13%), and Power Grid Corporation (-2.07%).
  • In contrast, IndusInd Bank (+2.05%) and Axis Bank (+0.44%) were the only stocks that gained.
"The US dollar is currently rallying due to positive jobs data, impacting the currency exchange rate significantly."

This downturn reflects broader concerns in the financial market, particularly in sectors like real estate, financial services, and consumer durables.
newTitle: Stock Market Crash: Sensex and Nifty Plummet as Rupee Hits Record Low

Shark Tank's Anupam Mittal calls out L&T chairman with hilarious question: 'If husband, wife don’t look at each other…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Anupam Mittal Responds Hilariously to L&T Chairman's Controversial Remarks

Date: Jan 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Anupam Mittal from Shark Tank India humorously responded to L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's remarks about employee productivity versus home life. His witty reply raised awareness on work-life balance issues.

  • L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan suggested he would prefer if employees worked on Sundays.
  • He posed a controversial question regarding how long employees could stare at their wives at home.
  • Anupam Mittal joked that if husbands and wives don't look at each other, India won't remain the most populous country.
  • Deepika Padukone and other public figures criticized Subrahmanyan's remarks, emphasizing the importance of mental health.
  • L&T attempted to clarify the chairman's comments, which some experts deemed insufficient.
“But sir, if husband and wife don’t look at each other, how will we remain the most populous country in the world?” - Anupam Mittal

The exchange highlights the ongoing discourse regarding workplace culture and the significance of mental health in corporate environments.
newTitle: Anupam Mittal Responds Hilariously to L&T Chairman's Controversial Remarks

Rupee to weaken past 86/USD on hawkish Fed outlook - The Economic Times
summary:
Rupee Dips Past 86/USD for the First Time on Hawkish Fed Outlook

Publication Date: [Date not specified] Source: [Source not specified]

The Indian rupee has weakened past the 86 to the U.S. dollar for the first time, prompted by a stronger than expected U.S. jobs report which has implications for the Federal Reserve's interest rate strategy.

  • The rupee opened at a record low of 86.2050, falling from 85.9650 the previous Friday.
  • 256,000 jobs were added in the U.S. last month, significantly above expectations of 160,000.
  • The unemployment rate in the U.S. unexpectedly declined to 4.1%.
  • Speculators are likely to continue holding bearish positions on the rupee due to the recent job numbers.
  • The Federal Reserve may focus more on inflation as concerns about job market risks diminish.
  • Market expectations suggest only one rate cut by the Fed for the year ahead.
  • The dollar index reached a two-year high of 109.72, reflecting the strength of the U.S. dollar.
  • 10-year U.S. bond yields have risen to 4.76%.
“Having said that, I think we are now near levels where a number of negatives (for the rupee) are in the price. Plus, we are long overdue a decent correction.” – A currency trader

This new low for the rupee reflects broader economic trends and investor sentiment towards U.S. monetary policy.
newTitle: Rupee Hits Historic Low of 86/USD Amid Hawkish Fed Outlook

title: As dense fog persists, IMD issues ‘orange’ alert across Delhi-NCR; routes to airport, highways likely to be affected - The Indian Express
summary:
IMD Issues Orange Alert for Dense Fog Across Delhi-NCR

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

As Delhi woke up to thick fog, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an 'orange' alert impacting travel across the national capital region.

  • The IMD warned of dense to very dense fog affecting routes to the airport, railway stations, and highways.
  • Low visibility of 50 meters recorded at Indira Gandhi International Airport; no significant disruptions in flight operations.
  • COM suggested the use of fog lights for vehicles and to remain in contact with transport authorities.
  • The forecast predicts temperatures ranging from 6 to 19 degrees Celsius for the upcoming days.
  • Air quality improved from 'very poor' to 'poor' at 278 AQI on Sunday.
  • Previous fog conditions caused delays in flights and trains.
“The last time visibility dropped to zero in Delhi was between January 2 and 3 for nine consecutive hours.”

Due to the ongoing fog, commuters are advised to take precautions and stay updated on travel conditions.
newTitle: IMD Issues Orange Alert for Dense Fog Across Delhi-NCR

title: California wildfires live updates: Death toll rises to 24, officials prepare for a ‘particularly dangerous situation’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
California Wildfires Update: Death Toll Reaches 24 Amid Dangerous Conditions

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The wildfires in California's Los Angeles County have led to a rising death toll of 24, with mandatory evacuation orders being lifted in several parts as officials brace for worsening weather conditions.

  • Twenty-four fatalities reported, with many more missing.
  • Over 12,000 structures have been damaged or destroyed.
  • Dangerous dry winds are expected to exacerbate the situation.
  • Evacuation orders in place for over 200,000 residents.
  • Governor Gavin Newsom has announced a “rebuilding plan” for affected areas.
“The fires are still raging in L.A. The incompetent pols have no idea how to put them out.” - Donald Trump

The fires represent one of the worst wildfire starts to a year for California, affecting countless lives and structures across the region.
newTitle: California Wildfires Update: Death Toll Reaches 24 Amid Dangerous Conditions

title: Severe winds return: Los Angeles wildfire death toll climbs to 24, 'fire tornado' spotted - The Times of India
summary:
Severe Winds Return: Los Angeles Wildfire Death Toll Climbs to 24, 'Fire Tornado' Spotted

Publication Date: [Not specified]; Source: [Not specified]

Firefighters are battling devastating wildfires in Los Angeles that have claimed 24 lives and destroyed thousands of homes. Governor Gavin Newsom warns this could be the most severe natural disaster in American history due to its extensive damage.

  • Over 40,000 acres have burned, surpassing San Francisco's size.
  • More than 12,000 structures destroyed, with around 150,000 residents evacuated.
  • Weather conditions have worsened with red flag warnings and winds up to 70 mph.
  • A fire tornado was reported, adding to the severity of the situation.
  • The estimated economic impact could reach between $135 billion and $150 billion.
Governor Gavin Newsom: "I think it will be in terms of just the costs associated with it, in terms of the scale and scope."

The situation remains critical, with authorities raising concerns over looting amidst the disaster, while additional resources are mobilized to combat the fires.
newTitle: Severe Winds Return: Los Angeles Wildfire Death Toll Climbs to 24, 'Fire Tornado' Spotted

title: Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected

Date: Jan 13, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

The Prayagraj police have enacted extensive security measures for Mahakumbh 2025, which is expected to draw over 45 crore attendees, taking place from January 13 to February 26.

  • The security configuration includes 102 checkpoints across seven key routes with thorough checks.
  • Authorities have deployed around 40,000 police personnel, utilizing AI for enhanced surveillance.
  • Robust mechanisms, including underwater drones and advanced AI cameras, are integrated into the security framework.
  • Major ceremonies will occur on auspicious dates like January 14, January 29, and February 3.
“Uttar Pradesh Police is committed to ensuring the safety of all participants,” said DGP Prashant Kumar.

This event is set to be the largest congregation of devotees, emphasizing the need for meticulous security arrangements.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025: Advanced Security Measures for Over 45 Crore Expected Visitors

title: Z-Morh tunnel: Security heightened in Kashmir as PM Modi visits today to inaugurate ‘engineering marvel’ | Details - Hindustan Times
summary:
Security Heightened in Kashmir for PM Modi's Inauguration of Z-Morh Tunnel

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Z-Morh tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir, with extensive security measures in place for the event.

  • PM Modi will inaugurate the strategically important Z-Morh tunnel planned to boost connectivity to Ladakh.
  • Security arrangements include the deployment of police, paramilitary forces, and the Army.
  • The Z-Morh tunnel is a 6.5-km long project estimated to cost ₹2,400 crore and is vital for year-round access to the Ladakh region.
  • Authorities temporarily closed the Srinagar-Leh national highway for security reasons during the inauguration.
  • The tunnel is expected to enhance tourism and facilitate military access.
“The Sonamarg Tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir is a game-changer for the region, offering more than just a connection between Gagangir and Sonamarg.” - NHIDCL

The inauguration is seen as a significant step in enhancing the infrastructure and security of the region.
newTitle: Security Heightened in Kashmir for PM Modi's Inauguration of Z-Morh Tunnel

title: IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25 - The Times of India
summary:
IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25

Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Times of India

The 18th season of the Indian Premier League (IPL) will begin on March 21, 2025, in Kolkata's Eden Gardens, with the final taking place on May 25, 2025.

  • The season starts a week later than previously announced.
  • The change in schedule is likely due to scheduling conflicts with the Champions Trophy final on March 9, although broadcasters have denied making a request for these adjustments.
  • Kolkata Knight Riders will host both the opener and the final.
  • Sunrisers Hyderabad will host two playoff games.
  • The complete schedule is expected to be released soon following BCCI meetings.
“The BCCI is expected to release the complete schedule shortly,” said BCCI vice-president Rajiv Shukla.

Overall, the IPL 2025 season promises exciting matches with a new revised schedule that avoids overlap with other major cricket events.
newTitle: IPL 2025 Schedule: Season to begin on March 21 in Kolkata, final set for May 25

title: Los Angeles fires: 24 dead, 12,000 structures destroyed | All you need to know - Hindustan Times
summary:
Los Angeles Fires: 24 Dead, 12,000 Structures Destroyed

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The devastating fires in Los Angeles have resulted in at least 24 fatalities, forced evacuations for over 150,000 residents, and destroyed more than 12,000 structures, making it one of the costliest fire events in U.S. history.

  • The fires have burned through an area larger than San Francisco.
  • Preliminary damage estimates range from USD 135 billion to USD 150 billion.
  • Major neighborhoods affected include Pacific Palisades and Altadena.
  • 335 schools were closed across multiple counties, affecting thousands of students.
  • California officials are investigating the causes, ruling out lightning as a factor.
  • Mayor Karen Bass faces criticism over the city’s crisis management and fire resources.
“The city’s leadership failed her department by not allocating enough funds for firefighting.” - Los Angeles Fire Chief Kristin Crowley

This event has brought significant disruptions to daily life and raised concerns over emergency preparedness and community resilience.
newTitle: Los Angeles Fires: 24 Lives Lost and 12,000 Structures Destroyed

Cummins, Hazlewood included for Champions Trophy - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Cummins and Hazlewood Named in Australia's Champions Trophy Squad

Publication Date: February 2024

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australia's cricket team has announced the inclusion of Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood in the squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy, despite injury concerns.

  • Pat Cummins, who is currently on paternity leave, will captain the team.
  • George Bailey clarified that the squad can be amended freely within the next four weeks.
  • Hazlewood is expected to recover from a calf injury in time for the tournament.
  • The squad is described as balanced and experienced, with players familiar from the previous one-day World Cup.
  • Australia's first ODI is against Sri Lanka on February 13.
  • They are grouped with England, South Africa, and Afghanistan in the tournament.
"This is a balanced and experienced squad with the core having been involved in the previous one-day World Cup," said George Bailey.

Australia is set to enter the Champions Trophy with a seasoned team, aiming for success based on their past experiences and preparations.
newTitle: Cummins and Hazlewood Named in Australia's Champions Trophy Squad

title: Karun Nair on selectors' radar amid India's Kohli-Rohit situation after fourth straight century in Vijay Hazare Trophy - Hindustan Times
summary:
Karun Nair scored 664 runs in Vijay Hazare Trophy without being dismissed

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Karun Nair, after a challenging period, is back on the selectors' radar following an impressive run in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, where he scored four consecutive centuries and a total of 664 runs without being dismissed.

  • Nair has scored five centuries in the current tournament, with the scores being 112*, 44*, 163*, 111*, 112*, and 122*.
  • This achievement marks the most runs scored in List A cricket without being dismissed.
  • Nair's resurgence comes as the Indian selectors are looking closely at players during a transitional phase for the team.
  • His performance has raised questions regarding his possible selection for the upcoming Champions Trophy.
“For six-seven months, when I didn’t play any cricket...I wasn’t considered for any format and I was really emotional at that point of time,” Nair reflected on his struggles.

Nair's ongoing success is a testament to his hard work and determination to reclaim a spot in the national team.
newTitle: Karun Nair's Remarkable Comeback in Vijay Hazare Trophy

title: 'Canada Is Not For Sale': Trudeau's Former Ally Jagmeet Singh Warns Trump Over Tariff Threat - News18
summary:
Jagmeet Singh Warns Trump: 'Canada Is Not For Sale'

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: News18

Jagmeet Singh, leader of the New Democratic Party, issued a warning to US President-elect Donald Trump regarding tariff threats and Canadian sovereignty.

  • Singh emphasized that Canada is not for sale and called for retaliatory tariffs against the US if Trump imposes his proposed tariffs.
  • He stated that Canadians are proud people willing to fight to protect their country.
  • Canadian officials are preparing to discuss potential retaliatory measures against US tariffs.
  • The Canadian government is considering tariffs on various US products if Trump proceeds with his plans.
“If Donald Trump thinks he can pick a fight with us, there will be a price to pay,” said Jagmeet Singh.

This situation highlights the tension between Canada and the US following Trump’s tariff threats and proposals for economic control over Canada.
newTitle: Jagmeet Singh Warns Trump: 'Canada Is Not For Sale'
